text: Hey, I might not be clear, I would like to replicate this input inside my application form, so I can get my registered API Keys, not just access the variable.
By the way, iâ€™m trying a trick to update a property each hour by zapier
And a workflow that got triggered by that

Hey all, does anyone know if it's possible to pull the meeting properties of meeting(s) associated with a contact (meeting start time, meeting end time, meeting outcome, etc.), and set a contact property to one of those values, in a custom-coded workflow action?
Oh so like accessing that variable from outside of a custom code action?

Sure, basically there isn't a way currently where you can limit your workflow to 10 objects at a time but you can kinda do this by unenrolling and reenrolling depending on how many objects are in the flow at the current time. For contact enrollments you can do this through the api but for all other objects you'll need to do this with reenrollment triggers
Thanks, I guess we will have to increase the logging on our end from custom actions :disappointed:

Having a issue with workflows bugging out.

I am getting a "Unable to update property because property value isn't valid" trying to set a datetime property.  This is an example of the result from the Custom Code Action: "start_date_401k":1665298800000 yet for some reason HubSpot is discarding it as not in datetime format (it is)

Am I missing something with the time of DateTime fields? I thought it was in epoch unix which 166.... is?
This seems to be working for me
thanks ; was some kind of weird ass glithc, had to literally log out then back in and that worked
Very strange, I had some problems with workflows last week
but it was due to one of the processes being down not on my end
